column1: Big Question: How do traffic signals at intersections influence the safety and mobility of older pedestrians?

column5: How often do you walk in urban areas? (Daily, several times a week, Weekly, Rarely)
column6: On a scale of 1- 5, how safe do you generally feel crossing intersections?
column7: Do you find standard traffic signals easy to understand and follow? (Yes/ No)
column8: Do you feel that you have enough time to cross the street at intersections?
column9: Are the pedestrian signals at intersections clear and easy to see? (Yes/ No)
column10: Are auditory cues helpful to you at an intersection?  (Yes/ No)
column11: Would you prefer more intersections to have auditory signals? (Yes/ No)
column12: Have you used intersections with pedestrian tactile paving?
column14: Have you ever experienced a near-miss or an accident at an intersection?
column15: What changes at intersections would make you feel safer and more confident as a pedestrian?

column13: very good, prevented him from slipping. He mentioned a bad experience in midtown without that paving
